Job Title: Research Assistant/Research Associate - Health Data Scientist (Fixed Term)
Job Description:
Research Assistant: £27,929 - £32,348
Research Associate: £34,308 - £42,155
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a key analytical role in the Department of Public Health and Primary Care, University of Cambridge, funded by Cancer Research UK. A key responsibility of the post holder will be to utilise population-wide electronic health records to investigate the generalisability and transportability of models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer.
The post-holder will contribute to the development and application of statistical and machine learning approaches to adapt models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer for clinical use in real world settings. The research will have translational and methodological impact.
The preferred candidate will have a PhD (or equivalent) in Health Data Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research or other related quantitative subjects. Otherwise, if the candidate can demonstrate an outstanding fit to all the other criteria, a good Masters degree in one of the relevant fields will also be considered. They will have strong computational skills in at least one of R, Python, SQL or Pyspark; experience of working with electronic health records; and a good understanding of and experience in statistics and machine learning.

About Qureight
Qureight is a MedTech company based in Cambridge, UK. It was founded by medical doctors in 2018. Our mission is to combine platform technology and life sciences to generate new insight and transform the way we use clinical data to improve the lives of patients with complex diseases.
Qureight utilises Machine Learning technology to curate and analyse clinical imaging data to better understand complex heart and lung diseases which benefits biopharma and academic institutions achieve new insights into understanding diseases and response to treatment.
Data Scientist
We have built a cloud-based platform which allows clients to upload, curate and analyse their data using advanced ML techniques. We are looking for skilled data scientists to help with the cleaning and analysis of our data, building ETL pipelines and statistical analysis.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. From a coffee connoisseur’s review of a neighborhood cafe, to a homeowner’s request for a quote to remodel their kitchen, Yelp’s data captures millions of user-business interactions every day.

The Consumer Data Science & Analytics team focuses on the people side of these interactions, harnessing the power of this data to understand and optimize Yelp’s user experience. We design and run experiments, build tools, and lead meaningful analyses that influence Yelp’s consumer product and business strategy.

This opportunity requires you to be located in the United Kingdom.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Analysis and Problem Solving: Work independently to develop and deliver analysis, within an overall project framework set by others, using more sophisticated tools where relevant. Help others team members to develop their own technical skills.

Apprentice Data Scientist

Do you have strong statistical or mathematical experience and want to use and develop those skills to help shape healthcare in Somerset?

If so we have an exciting new level 6 apprenticeship in the field of Data Science which will give you the opportunity to develop your career in this field. As a Data Scientist Apprentice you will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions.

In return you will be provided mentorship from our Lead Data Scientist as well as be supported in studying for a BSC in Data Science with Exeter College in partnership with Exeter University.

In order to undertake the BSC in Data Science you must meet the entry requirements:

Data Science (BSc Hons) (exe-coll.ac.uk)

The Data Scientist Apprentice will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions, and supporting the Improvement Team / Somerset Collaboration Hub in shaping healthcare in Somerset.

They will be supported to study a Level 6 Degree Apprenticeship:
Providing statistical insight about healthcare in Somerset, including robust analytics surrounding activity and performance.

Supporting the translation of analytical findings into real-world processes and as such provide evidence for service redesign.

Supporting projects to design, develop, test and validate intelligent modelling and predictive systems to improve information sharing and analysis.

Using mathematical, statistical and operational research techniques to effectively model and analyse a variety of statistical information, and make recommendations based on findings to improve operational, tactical and strategic business decisions.

Developing and refining data visualisation systems to present analytical results.

Working with local university and experts to validate new methodologies and proposed models, including contributing to proposals for additional funding.

Somerset NHS Foundation Trust endeavours to provide development opportunities for those looking to develop a career in the NHS, in both clinical and non-clinical roles.

Through our apprenticeship programmes, individuals can earn a salary, develop their skills, and achieve a nationally recognised qualification, all whilst contributing towards delivering excellent patient care.

We have six active and impactful colleague networks. These networks provide a safe space for colleagues to share their experiences and learn from one another, but also influence change across our trust:
As an organisation the NHS offers a wide range of benefits including flexible working, pension contributions, market leading annual leave allowance, career progression and regular conversations, not to mention our Blue Light Card and NHS Discounts.

You will work within the Business Process Development team to help build and launch new applications to support the business in streamlining our daily tasks and digital activities.

You will be surrounded by a supportive team who will be strongly invested in your development as a graduate into a successful data scientist and application developer within the business. The role will allow you to learn and develop skills that will have a significant and lasting impact within the business.

A major part of the role will include using a new development tool to Nissan, Auraquantic. You will be a key member of the team to learn the system and develop exciting new applications for the business giving you a fantastic opportunity to build on your current skillset and develop new skills. As you grow into the role you will have the opportunity to lead your own projects from concept to delivery.

You will need a creative and inquisitive mind within this role as well as the ability to work effectively and efficiently with large datasets from various sources. An understanding of process development and software solutions would be advantageous as well as a working knowledge of web and software application development tools and programming languages (SQL, Java, Python, HTML etc.).
Key Skills
Office 365 tools
Excel to intermediate/advanced level
Power Automate (advantageous)
Programming Languages SQL, Java, Python, HTML

The role is based in

Cranfield Bedfordshire United Kingdom

Please note that this team has a hub in the Microsoft UK HQ (Reading, Berkshire) however, hybrid/remote working within the UK is possible.

The Microsoft Applied Sciences Group incubates disruptive technologies for Microsoft’s next-gen hardware products and is working on several exciting projects that will shape how computers and other devices perceive the user and the user’s environment. Operating as a startup within the company, this team works closely with several research and product teams to bring compelling new experiences to the market. A lot of these experiences will be powered by computer vision – and as part of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to work on almost every aspect of a shipping vision system: camera optics, sensors, data pipeline and of course, developing and implementing the algorithms that make magic happen!
The team is growing, and we are looking for talented computer vision and machine learning researchers: people who love to invent and build new stuff that really works and can be deployed to millions of users.

Job title: Data Scientist
Location: Agile working with regular travel to our base in Leeds. Occasional travel to London and other areas of the UK.

As a Data Scientist you will:
Extract, analyse and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources using statistical tools, in order that it can be used to inform policy decisions about pay and workforce issues and support national pay negotiations.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe, from a user reviewing a neighborhood coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners, and the general public.

The Data Science team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s business and users. Our centralized team is the most wide-ranging consumer of data at Yelp, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about the health of local economies. With varied backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity requires you to be located in the United Kingdom.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Overview:
Exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Scientist to work in an expanding national data team within a large charity.

Responsibilities:
Change, grow, live is a social care and health charity that supports people to change their lives for the better. We are the largest provider of drug and alcohol services across England, Wales and Scotland.

We are recruiting for a Junior Data Scientist who will play an instrumental role in transforming our analytical capabilities. To this end, we are seeking a candidate who is excited by the power of data and can apply their knowledge and use of statistics.

A sound knowledge of Excel is essential as this will lay the foundations as we continue to move to the use of more innovative tools and systems.

We use Alteryx and Tableau however experience of these is desirable but not essential; we are seeking a candidate who is excited by the use of these technologies and full training and support will be provided.

The successful candidate will hold strong technical skills and will come with their own ideas and experiences of how data science, its tools and systems, can provided valuable insight. Meticulous, tenacious and flexible in approach, you will be comfortable working on your own, and as part of a highly geographically disparate team. You will be solution focused.

For those applicants successful at the first stage, there will be a technical test and "meet the team" day on 3rd November 2022. This will be in Leeds and will require people to attend in person. For people who are successful in the technical test, the interviews will be held following this on 8th November 2022. These will also be held in Leeds.

Bioinformatician / Data Scientist
Apply: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3312690326/
Location: Hinxton, Cambridgeshire.
Job Type: Full-time
Work Model: Hybrid working. Some time required on-site
Company Overview
Broken String Biosciences is a Cambridge-based genomics company with the goal of developing safer cell and gene therapies by assessing the stability of the genome. We are leveraging state of the art genomic sequencing technologies to better understand the factors that determine on and off-target activity during CRISPR genome editing, with the vision to build a technology platform that will drive the development of CRISPR gene therapies that are safer by design. Starting with our first patented technology, INDUCE-seq, which for the first time enables precise digital mapping of DNA double strand breaks in the genome, Broken String Biosciences is building a suite of genomics technologies that will assess all elements of genetic safety during the genome editing process. This will provide the information required to design CRISPR gene therapies that are fundamentally safer, ensuring that this potentially life-saving technology can be delivered to patients.

Job Title: Research Assistant/Research Associate - Health Data Scientist (Fixed Term)
Job Description:
Research Assistant: £27,929 - £32,348
Research Associate: £34,308 - £42,155
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a key analytical role in the Department of Public Health and Primary Care, University of Cambridge, funded by Cancer Research UK. A key responsibility of the post holder will be to utilise population-wide electronic health records to investigate the generalisability and transportability of models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer.
The post-holder will contribute to the development and application of statistical and machine learning approaches to adapt models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer for clinical use in real world settings. The research will have translational and methodological impact.
The preferred candidate will have a PhD (or equivalent) in Health Data Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research or other related quantitative subjects. Otherwise, if the candidate can demonstrate an outstanding fit to all the other criteria, a good Masters degree in one of the relevant fields will also be considered. They will have strong computational skills in at least one of R, Python, SQL or Pyspark; experience of working with electronic health records; and a good understanding of and experience in statistics and machine learning.

Job Title: Graduate Invent Accelerate Programme - Analytics & AI - Manchester 2023
Job Description:
Graduate Invent Accelerate Programme – Analytics & Artificial Intelligence 2023
Multiple intakes across 2023
What is the Accelerate Analytics & Artificial Intelligence Pathway?
The Analytics and AI (A&AI) pathway of the Accelerate programme is designed for talented graduates passionate about analytics and data science, who are looking for a role where they can combine strategy, technology data science and creative design to help clients solve complex business challenges.

Upon graduating from the programme, you will join our Analytics & AI team where we collaborate with our clients to improve their use of data and enable them to become truly data-driven enterprises. We’ve built a successful team of experts in a variety of fields such as Data Science, Data Strategy, Cloud Platforms, Data Visualisation, Intelligent Automation, Business Intelligence and Data Governance and leverage these capabilities to solve complex industry problems across a variety of sectors.
The Focus of Your Role
As an Associate Consultant you will embark on a stimulating and exciting journey where you will develop key skills that influence how our clients evolve the way they work, perform and achieve their goals. You’ll have the opportunity to work on large scale transformation programmes. You will ensure the smooth delivery of end-to-end projects by working flexibly, demonstrating intellectual capability and delivering innovative solutions for clients. The day-to-day tasks can vary from engagement with senior stakeholders, conducting analysis of data, designing business strategies to delivering workshops. Your projects could be in Consumer Products & Retail, Financial Services & Insurance, Government, Utilities, Manufacturing, Automotive & Life Sciences (MALS) or Technology, Media and Telecommunications (TMT).

About The Junior Data Scientist role

A key role across our practice areas, the Junior Data Scientist will help support these practices with continuing growth. The successful candidate will work across a number of projects working closely with the wider team.

Analysis and Problem Solving: Work independently to develop and deliver analysis, within an overall project framework set by others, using more sophisticated tools where relevant. Help others team members to develop their own technical skills.

Communication Skills: Ability to flex style in day to day contact internally and with clients, in addition to clearly structured written work.

Job Title: Investigative Analytics Data Scientist (Deals Insights & Analytics)
Job Description:
In Deals we solve the important problems that stand in the way of value being created, sustained, realised or protected for our clients – working together to aid responsible recovery and growth.
Working on iconic deals with national and global clients, we put together major mergers and acquisitions and resolve business crises - from international take-over bids to financial crime investigations and cases of insolvency.
We draw upon our deals experience across many industries to support and partner with our clients, to positively impact society and the communities in which we operate.
Deals Insights and Analytics (DIA)
We work across the Deals lifecycle with some of the worlds’ market leading clients. We support them before, during and after a transaction by providing best in class data analytics and modelling solutions. Our focus is on the development and application of cutting-edge analytical and modelling techniques to produce rapid, pragmatic, and clear outcomes for our clients. We help them to make better decisions and solve problems. Our purpose is to support the increasingly sophisticated client demand for advanced data-driven insights to underpin their critical investment decisions.

About Qureight
Qureight is a MedTech company based in Cambridge, UK. It was founded by medical doctors in 2018. Our mission is to combine platform technology and life sciences to generate new insight and transform the way we use clinical data to improve the lives of patients with complex diseases.
Qureight utilises Machine Learning technology to curate and analyse clinical imaging data to better understand complex heart and lung diseases which benefits biopharma and academic institutions achieve new insights into understanding diseases and response to treatment.
Data Scientist
We have built a cloud-based platform which allows clients to upload, curate and analyse their data using advanced ML techniques. We are looking for skilled data scientists to help with the cleaning and analysis of our data, building ETL pipelines and statistical analysis.

Reqiva have partnered with an expanding Agritech company funded to catalyse the UK agri-food industry through big data and advanced analytics.

They are looking for a Data Scientist to join their growing team and working within a mixture of their agri-food, life sciences and Earth Observation domain.

This is a remote first opportunity, however they do have two offices open where you can go into the office if that is something you prefer. These are located in Reading and North London.

For this role they are looking for someone with proven experience but with this they are looking to pay between £50,000 - £60,000 per annum (Depending on experience).

Proven data science experience and competency:
This role is only for UK residence and doesn't offer sponsorship.

Apprentice Data Scientist

Do you have strong statistical or mathematical experience and want to use and develop those skills to help shape healthcare in Somerset?

If so we have an exciting new level 6 apprenticeship in the field of Data Science which will give you the opportunity to develop your career in this field. As a Data Scientist Apprentice you will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions.

In return you will be provided mentorship from our Lead Data Scientist as well as be supported in studying for a BSC in Data Science with Exeter College in partnership with Exeter University.

In order to undertake the BSC in Data Science you must meet the entry requirements:
**If you do not have these qualifications, you will be invited to complete a maths assessment. This is used to establish your current mathematical abilities and suitability for the Level 6 project content.

Data Science (BSc Hons) (exe-coll.ac.uk)

The Data Scientist Apprentice will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions, and supporting the Improvement Team / Somerset Collaboration Hub in shaping healthcare in Somerset.

They will be supported to study a Level 6 Degree Apprenticeship:
Providing statistical insight about healthcare in Somerset, including robust analytics surrounding activity and performance.

Supporting the translation of analytical findings into real-world processes and as such provide evidence for service redesign.

Supporting projects to design, develop, test and validate intelligent modelling and predictive systems to improve information sharing and analysis.

Using mathematical, statistical and operational research techniques to effectively model and analyse a variety of statistical information, and make recommendations based on findings to improve operational, tactical and strategic business decisions.

Developing and refining data visualisation systems to present analytical results.

Working with local university and experts to validate new methodologies and proposed models, including contributing to proposals for additional funding.

Somerset NHS Foundation Trust endeavours to provide development opportunities for those looking to develop a career in the NHS, in both clinical and non-clinical roles.

Through our apprenticeship programmes, individuals can earn a salary, develop their skills, and achieve a nationally recognised qualification, all whilst contributing towards delivering excellent patient care.

As an organisation the NHS offers a wide range of benefits including flexible working, pension contributions, market leading annual leave allowance, career progression and regular conversations, not to mention our Blue Light Card and NHS Discounts.

Job Title: Graduate, Data Analytics, Risk, Manchester, Autumn 2023
Job Description:
The world of risk is changing. Today's business environment is different. More complex. More connected. More volatile. While this environment makes it much harder to predict where new risks will come from, we believe that it represents an opportunity for businesses to transform and innovate. We work with our clients to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business; from people to performance, systems to strategy and business plans to business resilience. Through our invaluable insights and independent assurance we can help our clients to discover and unlock real value.

Our capabilities, scale and ability to bring together leading-edge specialists to tackle the toughest risk situations helps us create a sustainable competitive advantage. But it's our people, their curiosity and the inclusive, collaborative culture that sets us apart. Difference makes a difference and individuality is celebrated and embraced. We’re investing in growth and innovation. Our people are supported by the right tools and technology to strengthen our business and stay at the cutting-edge of new techniques. We nurture bold and dynamic behaviours to push the boundaries and be truly distinctive in the market.

A bit about us
Our main focus at Waterstons is to help our customers build a better business by blending technology and strategy. We have offices in the UK and Australia. Our team also work across the globe to provide unique business solutions that directly adds value to our clients’ businesses.
Our clients tell us our people are our greatest strength, and who are we to disagree? We believe in our colleagues, and we make it a priority to reward their hard work. Unlimited holidays, flexible working, and private medical healthcare. These are only some of the amazing things we offer.
Did we also mention that we’ve been awarded Gold Investors in People for a fourth consecutive time?
This role will be based at either our Durham office or London office.

Job title: Data Scientist
Location: Agile working with regular travel to our base in Leeds. Occasional travel to London and other areas of the UK.
Role: Full time / part time – Permanent role
Salary: £39,073
As a Data Scientist you will:
Extract, analyse and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources using statistical tools, in order that it can be used to inform policy decisions about pay and workforce issues and support national pay negotiations.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe, from a user reviewing a neighborhood coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners, and the general public.

The Data Science team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s business and users. Our centralized team is the most wide-ranging consumer of data at Yelp, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about the health of local economies. With varied backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity requires you to be located in the United Kingdom.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Want to build yourself a legacy you’ll always be proud of? Our most innovative grad scheme yet is your chance to do just that. Intentionally designed to help you shape the fast-moving world of retail, it’s a masterclass in technical training, structured mentorship, and 360-feedback. Spanning 18-24 months, you’ll rotate around our business up to four times – each time earning, learning and experiencing it all. It’s all about giving you exposure to a variety of projects and the talented people driving them – so you come to realise that there’s infinite ways to the top at M&S. If you’re ready to become an M&S Legend of Tomorrow, it’s time to begin.
Take your place in our Data Science teams and you’ll find everything you need to begin shaping the world of retail – your way. From access to in-house development programmes to external Decoded Data Science courses that’ll help you become an expert in your field, this is a springboard on to big things.
Our teams apply data science across the whole business – from solving customer problems like offer personalisation and online recommendation, to enterprise challenges like buying optimisation, sales forecasting, and labour planning. We use a wide variety of the core data science techniques and more to deliver millions of pounds in extra profit to the business every year. Want to be a part of some of the most innovative teams in British retail?

Exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Scientist to work in an expanding national data team within a large charity.

Responsibilities:
Change, grow, live is a social care and health charity that supports people to change their lives for the better. We are the largest provider of drug and alcohol services across England, Wales and Scotland.

We are recruiting for a Junior Data Scientist who will play an instrumental role in transforming our analytical capabilities. To this end, we are seeking a candidate who is excited by the power of data and can apply their knowledge and use of statistics.

A sound knowledge of Excel is essential as this will lay the foundations as we continue to move to the use of more innovative tools and systems.

We use Alteryx and Tableau however experience of these is desirable but not essential; we are seeking a candidate who is excited by the use of these technologies and full training and support will be provided.

The successful candidate will hold strong technical skills and will come with their own ideas and experiences of how data science, its tools and systems, can provided valuable insight. Meticulous, tenacious and flexible in approach, you will be comfortable working on your own, and as part of a highly geographically disparate team. You will be solution focused.

Bioinformatician / Data Scientist
Apply: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3312690326/
Location: Hinxton, Cambridgeshire.
Job Type: Full-time
Work Model: Hybrid working. Some time required on-site
Company Overview
Broken String Biosciences is a Cambridge-based genomics company with the goal of developing safer cell and gene therapies by assessing the stability of the genome. We are leveraging state of the art genomic sequencing technologies to better understand the factors that determine on and off-target activity during CRISPR genome editing, with the vision to build a technology platform that will drive the development of CRISPR gene therapies that are safer by design. Starting with our first patented technology, INDUCE-seq, which for the first time enables precise digital mapping of DNA double strand breaks in the genome, Broken String Biosciences is building a suite of genomics technologies that will assess all elements of genetic safety during the genome editing process. This will provide the information required to design CRISPR gene therapies that are fundamentally safer, ensuring that this potentially life-saving technology can be delivered to patients.

The Analytics and AI (A&AI) pathway of the Accelerate programme is designed for talented graduates passionate about analytics and data science, who are looking for a role where they can combine strategy, technology data science and creative design to help clients solve complex business challenges.

Job Title: Research Assistant/Research Associate - Health Data Scientist (Fixed Term)
Job Description:
Research Assistant: £27,929 - £32,348
Research Associate: £34,308 - £42,155
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a key analytical role in the Department of Public Health and Primary Care, University of Cambridge, funded by Cancer Research UK. A key responsibility of the post holder will be to utilise population-wide electronic health records to investigate the generalisability and transportability of models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer.
The post-holder will contribute to the development and application of statistical and machine learning approaches to adapt models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer for clinical use in real world settings. The research will have translational and methodological impact.
The preferred candidate will have a PhD (or equivalent) in Health Data Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research or other related quantitative subjects. Otherwise, if the candidate can demonstrate an outstanding fit to all the other criteria, a good Masters degree in one of the relevant fields will also be considered. They will have strong computational skills in at least one of R, Python, SQL or Pyspark; experience of working with electronic health records; and a good understanding of and experience in statistics and machine learning.

Are you a natural problem solver who enjoys analysing and manipulating data? Do you have strong knowledge of SQL? Are you looking for an opportunity to learn and grow?
If your answer is 'yes' to all of these, keep reading.

Communication Skills: Ability to flex style in day to day contact internally and with clients, in addition to clearly structured written work.

The Microsoft Applied Sciences Group incubates disruptive technologies for Microsoft’s next-gen hardware products and is working on several exciting projects that will shape how computers and other devices perceive the user and the user’s environment. Company Name:

4.1
Job Description:
Contracting Authority: UKHSA
Location: Remote working
At UKHSA our mission is to provide health security for the nation by protecting from infectious disease and external hazards.
The UKHSA mission is challenging, innovative and in the spotlight. We work to ensure our people have the diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds we need to thrive, and that staff members feel valued and enabled to play their part in delivering our work.
Creating our working culture is an ongoing process which we are developing by listening and learning together, hearing and acting upon diverse voices and opinions. The work will continue through the first months and years of the organisation to develop a common sense of identity and effective ways of working.
As a Data Scientist your main responsibilities would be:

Apprentice Data Scientist

Do you have strong statistical or mathematical experience and want to use and develop those skills to help shape healthcare in Somerset?

If so we have an exciting new level 6 apprenticeship in the field of Data Science which will give you the opportunity to develop your career in this field. As a Data Scientist Apprentice you will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions.

In return you will be provided mentorship from our Lead Data Scientist as well as be supported in studying for a BSC in Data Science with Exeter College in partnership with Exeter University.

In order to undertake the BSC in Data Science you must meet the entry requirements:
**If you do not have these qualifications, you will be invited to complete a maths assessment. This is used to establish your current mathematical abilities and suitability for the Level 6 project content.

Data Science (BSc Hons) (exe-coll.ac.uk)

The Data Scientist Apprentice will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions, and supporting the Improvement Team / Somerset Collaboration Hub in shaping healthcare in Somerset.

They will be supported to study a Level 6 Degree Apprenticeship:
Providing statistical insight about healthcare in Somerset, including robust analytics surrounding activity and performance.

Supporting the translation of analytical findings into real-world processes and as such provide evidence for service redesign.

Supporting projects to design, develop, test and validate intelligent modelling and predictive systems to improve information sharing and analysis.

Using mathematical, statistical and operational research techniques to effectively model and analyse a variety of statistical information, and make recommendations based on findings to improve operational, tactical and strategic business decisions.

Developing and refining data visualisation systems to present analytical results.

Working with local university and experts to validate new methodologies and proposed models, including contributing to proposals for additional funding.

Somerset NHS Foundation Trust endeavours to provide development opportunities for those looking to develop a career in the NHS, in both clinical and non-clinical roles.

Through our apprenticeship programmes, individuals can earn a salary, develop their skills, and achieve a nationally recognised qualification, all whilst contributing towards delivering excellent patient care.

We have six active and impactful colleague networks. These networks provide a safe space for colleagues to share their experiences and learn from one another, but also influence change across our trust:
As an organisation the NHS offers a wide range of benefits including flexible working, pension contributions, market leading annual leave allowance, career progression and regular conversations, not to mention our Blue Light Card and NHS Discounts.


Please note - Eligibility checks, and verification of qualifications will be completed by the Trust and University, and all places are conditional and subject to this confirmation.

For more specific information relating to this post, please see the attached job description and person specification.

For further information on the Apprenticeship programme please contact:

Apprentices@exe-coll.ac.uk
01392 400800

In Deals we solve the important problems that stand in the way of value being created, sustained, realised or protected for our clients – working together to aid responsible recovery and growth.
Working on iconic deals with national and global clients, we put together major mergers and acquisitions and resolve business crises - from international take-over bids to financial crime investigations and cases of insolvency.
We draw upon our deals experience across many industries to support and partner with our clients, to positively impact society and the communities in which we operate.
Deals Insights and Analytics (DIA)
We work across the Deals lifecycle with some of the worlds’ market leading clients. We support them before, during and after a transaction by providing best in class data analytics and modelling solutions. Our focus is on the development and application of cutting-edge analytical and modelling techniques to produce rapid, pragmatic, and clear outcomes for our clients. We help them to make better decisions and solve problems. Our purpose is to support the increasingly sophisticated client demand for advanced data-driven insights to underpin their critical investment decisions.

Work-from-home days
Growth opportunities

You will be a key player analytical and modelling activity to craft and deliver on projects covering topics such as supplier selection, pathway management, operational efficiency and cost leakage detection.
Skills and experience we’re looking for:

Reqiva have partnered with an expanding Agritech company funded to catalyse the UK agri-food industry through big data and advanced analytics.

They are looking for a Data Scientist to join their growing team and working within a mixture of their agri-food, life sciences and Earth Observation domain.

This is a remote first opportunity, however they do have two offices open where you can go into the office if that is something you prefer. These are located in Reading and North London.

For this role they are looking for someone with proven experience but with this they are looking to pay between £50,000 - £60,000 per annum (Depending on experience).

Proven data science experience and competency:
This role is only for UK residence and doesn't offer sponsorship.

The Company

Cover Genius is a Series C global Insurtech with a vision to protect all the customers of the world’s largest digital companies. Partners such as Booking.com, eBay, Shopee, Ola, Wayfair and AXS have integrated XCover, our insurance distribution platform that embeds protection for millions of worldwide customers each year.
Our team and products have been recognised with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times who ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 10 countries and many language groups commits itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular “CG Gives” which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities.

Our People are Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired

Our People are not Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious

We work across the entire value chain, designing and delivering active ingredients, formulations and devices required to support new medicines – from supplies for use in early toxicology studies and clinical trials to developing the technology to ensure drugs can be scaled up for commercial manufacture.

About Qureight
Qureight is a MedTech company based in Cambridge, UK. It was founded by medical doctors in 2018. Our mission is to combine platform technology and life sciences to generate new insight and transform the way we use clinical data to improve the lives of patients with complex diseases.
Qureight utilises Machine Learning technology to curate and analyse clinical imaging data to better understand complex heart and lung diseases which benefits biopharma and academic institutions achieve new insights into understanding diseases and response to treatment.
Data Scientist
We have built a cloud-based platform which allows clients to upload, curate and analyse their data using advanced ML techniques. We are looking for skilled data scientists to help with the cleaning and analysis of our data, building ETL pipelines and statistical analysis.

We’ve built a successful team of experts in a variety of fields such as Data Science, Data Strategy, Cloud Platforms, Data Visualisation, Intelligent Automation, Business Intelligence and Data Governance and leverage these capabilities to solve complex industry problems across a variety of sectors.
The Focus of Your Role
As an Associate Consultant you will embark on a stimulating and exciting journey where you will develop key skills that influence how our clients evolve the way they work, perform and achieve their goals. You’ll have the opportunity to work on large scale transformation programmes. You will ensure the smooth delivery of end-to-end projects by working flexibly, demonstrating intellectual capability and delivering innovative solutions for clients. The day-to-day tasks can vary from engagement with senior stakeholders, conducting analysis of data, designing business strategies to delivering workshops. Your projects could be in Consumer Products & Retail, Financial Services & Insurance, Government, Utilities, Manufacturing, Automotive & Life Sciences (MALS) or Technology, Media and Telecommunications (TMT).

Job Title: Research Assistant/Research Associate - Health Data Scientist (Fixed Term)
Job Description:
Research Assistant: £27,929 - £32,348
Research Associate: £34,308 - £42,155
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a key analytical role in the Department of Public Health and Primary Care, University of Cambridge, funded by Cancer Research UK. A key responsibility of the post holder will be to utilise population-wide electronic health records to investigate the generalisability and transportability of models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer.
The post-holder will contribute to the development and application of statistical and machine learning approaches to adapt models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer for clinical use in real world settings. The research will have translational and methodological impact.
The preferred candidate will have a PhD (or equivalent) in Health Data Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research or other related quantitative subjects. Otherwise, if the candidate can demonstrate an outstanding fit to all the other criteria, a good Masters degree in one of the relevant fields will also be considered. They will have strong computational skills in at least one of R, Python, SQL or Pyspark; experience of working with electronic health records; and a good understanding of and experience in statistics and machine learning.

About The Junior Data Scientist role

A key role across our practice areas, the Junior Data Scientist will help support these practices with continuing growth. The successful candidate will work across a number of projects working closely with the wider team.

Analysis and Problem Solving: Work independently to develop and deliver analysis, within an overall project framework set by others, using more sophisticated tools where relevant. Help others team members to develop their own technical skills.

Communication Skills: Ability to flex style in day to day contact internally and with clients, in addition to clearly structured written work.

Are you a natural problem solver who enjoys analysing and manipulating data? Do you have strong knowledge of SQL? Are you looking for an opportunity to learn and grow?
If your answer is 'yes' to all of these, keep reading.
Want to know a little about us?
At Novuna, we care about building a better tomorrow. With a focus on sustainability, and a passion for phenomenal customer experiences, we provide consumers and businesses with the capital they need to realise their ambitions.
We're proud to be a Top 50 Inclusive employer, and we're number 11 in Glassdoor's Top 50 Employer list.
What does the role involve?

The Opportunity
This is a fantastic career opportunity for a graduate to enter the automotive industry and play a key role in the Customer Management Office (CMO) team. This role will involve supporting the CMO team in data analysis and reporting, and in delivering projects and programs.
Key responsibilities include:

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. From a coffee connoisseur’s review of a neighborhood cafe, to a homeowner’s request for a quote to remodel their kitchen, Yelp’s data captures millions of user-business interactions every day.

The Consumer Data Science & Analytics team focuses on the people side of these interactions, harnessing the power of this data to understand and optimize Yelp’s user experience. We design and run experiments, build tools, and lead meaningful analyses that influence Yelp’s consumer product and business strategy.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Bioinformatician / Data Scientist
Apply: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3312690326/
Location: Hinxton, Cambridgeshire.
Job Type: Full-time
Work Model: Hybrid working. Some time required on-site
Company Overview
Broken String Biosciences is a Cambridge-based genomics company with the goal of developing safer cell and gene therapies by assessing the stability of the genome. We are leveraging state of the art genomic sequencing technologies to better understand the factors that determine on and off-target activity during CRISPR genome editing, with the vision to build a technology platform that will drive the development of CRISPR gene therapies that are safer by design. Starting with our first patented technology, INDUCE-seq, which for the first time enables precise digital mapping of DNA double strand breaks in the genome, Broken String Biosciences is building a suite of genomics technologies that will assess all elements of genetic safety during the genome editing process. This will provide the information required to design CRISPR gene therapies that are fundamentally safer, ensuring that this potentially life-saving technology can be delivered to patients.

A bit about us
Our main focus at Waterstons is to help our customers build a better business by blending technology and strategy. We have offices in the UK and Australia. Our team also work across the globe to provide unique business solutions that directly adds value to our clients’ businesses.
Our clients tell us our people are our greatest strength, and who are we to disagree? We believe in our colleagues, and we make it a priority to reward their hard work. Unlimited holidays, flexible working, and private medical healthcare. These are only some of the amazing things we offer.
Did we also mention that we’ve been awarded Gold Investors in People for a fourth consecutive time?
This role will be based at either our Durham office or London office.

Apprentice Data Scientist

Do you have strong statistical or mathematical experience and want to use and develop those skills to help shape healthcare in Somerset?

If so we have an exciting new level 6 apprenticeship in the field of Data Science which will give you the opportunity to develop your career in this field. As a Data Scientist Apprentice you will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions.

In return you will be provided mentorship from our Lead Data Scientist as well as be supported in studying for a BSC in Data Science with Exeter College in partnership with Exeter University.

In order to undertake the BSC in Data Science you must meet the entry requirements:
**If you do not have these qualifications, you will be invited to complete a maths assessment. This is used to establish your current mathematical abilities and suitability for the Level 6 project content.

Data Science (BSc Hons) (exe-coll.ac.uk)

The Data Scientist Apprentice will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions, and supporting the Improvement Team / Somerset Collaboration Hub in shaping healthcare in Somerset.

They will be supported to study a Level 6 Degree Apprenticeship:
Providing statistical insight about healthcare in Somerset, including robust analytics surrounding activity and performance.

Supporting the translation of analytical findings into real-world processes and as such provide evidence for service redesign.

Supporting projects to design, develop, test and validate intelligent modelling and predictive systems to improve information sharing and analysis.

Using mathematical, statistical and operational research techniques to effectively model and analyse a variety of statistical information, and make recommendations based on findings to improve operational, tactical and strategic business decisions.

Developing and refining data visualisation systems to present analytical results.

Working with local university and experts to validate new methodologies and proposed models, including contributing to proposals for additional funding.

Somerset NHS Foundation Trust endeavours to provide development opportunities for those looking to develop a career in the NHS, in both clinical and non-clinical roles.

Through our apprenticeship programmes, individuals can earn a salary, develop their skills, and achieve a nationally recognised qualification, all whilst contributing towards delivering excellent patient care.

We have six active and impactful colleague networks. These networks provide a safe space for colleagues to share their experiences and learn from one another, but also influence change across our trust:
As an organisation the NHS offers a wide range of benefits including flexible working, pension contributions, market leading annual leave allowance, career progression and regular conversations, not to mention our Blue Light Card and NHS Discounts.


Please note - Eligibility checks, and verification of qualifications will be completed by the Trust and University, and all places are conditional and subject to this confirmation.

Job Title: Graduate, Data Analytics, Risk, Manchester, Autumn 2023

The world of risk is changing. Today's business environment is different. More complex. More connected. More volatile. While this environment makes it much harder to predict where new risks will come from, we believe that it represents an opportunity for businesses to transform and innovate. We work with our clients to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business; from people to performance, systems to strategy and business plans to business resilience. Through our invaluable insights and independent assurance we can help our clients to discover and unlock real value.

Our capabilities, scale and ability to bring together leading-edge specialists to tackle the toughest risk situations helps us create a sustainable competitive advantage. But it's our people, their curiosity and the inclusive, collaborative culture that sets us apart. Difference makes a difference and individuality is celebrated and embraced. We’re investing in growth and innovation. Our people are supported by the right tools and technology to strengthen our business and stay at the cutting-edge of new techniques. The Microsoft Applied Sciences Group incubates disruptive technologies for Microsoft’s next-gen hardware products and is working on several exciting projects that will shape how computers and other devices perceive the user and the user’s environment. Operating as a startup within the company, this team works closely with several research and product teams to bring compelling new experiences to the market. A lot of these experiences will be powered by computer vision – and as part of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to work on almost every aspect of a shipping vision system: camera optics, sensors, data pipeline and of course, developing and implementing the algorithms that make magic happen!
The team is growing, and we are looking for talented computer vision and machine learning researchers: people who love to invent and build new stuff that really works and can be deployed to millions of users.

While you will be a full-time employee throughout the program, you’ll also benefit from dedicated professional and personal development opportunities during your rotations to help you identify what excites you the most about your career future. Our People are not Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious

Job title: Data Scientist
Location: Agile working with regular travel to our base in Leeds. Occasional travel to London and other areas of the UK.
Role: Full time / part time – Permanent role
Salary: £39,073
As a Data Scientist you will:
Extract, analyse and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources using statistical tools, in order that it can be used to inform policy decisions about pay and workforce issues and support national pay negotiations.

Want to build yourself a legacy you’ll always be proud of? Our most innovative grad scheme yet is your chance to do just that. Intentionally designed to help you shape the fast-moving world of retail, it’s a masterclass in technical training, structured mentorship, and 360-feedback. Spanning 18-24 months, you’ll rotate around our business up to four times – each time earning, learning and experiencing it all. It’s all about giving you exposure to a variety of projects and the talented people driving them – so you come to realise that there’s infinite ways to the top at M&S. If you’re ready to become an M&S Legend of Tomorrow, it’s time to begin.
Take your place in our Data Science teams and you’ll find everything you need to begin shaping the world of retail – your way. From access to in-house development programmes to external Decoded Data Science courses that’ll help you become an expert in your field, this is a springboard on to big things.
Our teams apply data science across the whole business – from solving customer problems like offer personalisation and online recommendation, to enterprise challenges like buying optimisation, sales forecasting, and labour planning. We use a wide variety of the core data science techniques and more to deliver millions of pounds in extra profit to the business every year. Want to be a part of some of the most innovative teams in British retail?

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe, from a user reviewing a neighborhood coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners, and the general public.

The Data Science team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s business and users. Our centralized team is the most wide-ranging consumer of data at Yelp, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about the health of local economies. With varied backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity requires you to be located in the United Kingdom.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

**If you do not have these qualifications, you will be invited to complete a maths assessment. This is used to establish your current mathematical abilities and suitability for the Level 6 project content.

Data Science (BSc Hons) (exe-coll.ac.uk)

The Data Scientist Apprentice will assist the Lead Data Scientist in all manner of operational investigations, predictive data analytics and modelling, providing evidence for strategic and operational decisions, and supporting the Improvement Team / Somerset Collaboration Hub in shaping healthcare in Somerset.

They will be supported to study a Level 6 Degree Apprenticeship:
Providing statistical insight about healthcare in Somerset, including robust analytics surrounding activity and performance.

Supporting the translation of analytical findings into real-world processes and as such provide evidence for service redesign.

Supporting projects to design, develop, test and validate intelligent modelling and predictive systems to improve information sharing and analysis.

Using mathematical, statistical and operational research techniques to effectively model and analyse a variety of statistical information, and make recommendations based on findings to improve operational, tactical and strategic business decisions.

Developing and refining data visualisation systems to present analytical results.

Working with local university and experts to validate new methodologies and proposed models, including contributing to proposals for additional funding.

Somerset NHS Foundation Trust endeavours to provide development opportunities for those looking to develop a career in the NHS, in both clinical and non-clinical roles.

Through our apprenticeship programmes, individuals can earn a salary, develop their skills, and achieve a nationally recognised qualification, all whilst contributing towards delivering excellent patient care.

We have six active and impactful colleague networks. These networks provide a safe space for colleagues to share their experiences and learn from one another, but also influence change across our trust:
As an organisation the NHS offers a wide range of benefits including flexible working, pension contributions, market leading annual leave allowance, career progression and regular conversations, not to mention our Blue Light Card and NHS Discounts.

Job Description:
You're the brains behind our work.
You’re ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom and Citi wants to help you get there. DigitalGenius is a venture-backed artificial intelligence company bringing practical applications of deep learning and AI to some of the largest customer service operations in the world as well as high growth companies. Role

Bioinformatician / Data Scientist
Apply: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3312690326/
Location: Hinxton, Cambridgeshire.
Job Type: Full-time
Work Model: Hybrid working. Some time required on-site
Company Overview
Broken String Biosciences is a Cambridge-based genomics company with the goal of developing safer cell and gene therapies by assessing the stability of the genome. We are leveraging state of the art genomic sequencing technologies to better understand the factors that determine on and off-target activity during CRISPR genome editing, with the vision to build a technology platform that will drive the development of CRISPR gene therapies that are safer by design. Starting with our first patented technology, INDUCE-seq, which for the first time enables precise digital mapping of DNA double strand breaks in the genome, Broken String Biosciences is building a suite of genomics technologies that will assess all elements of genetic safety during the genome editing process. This will provide the information required to design CRISPR gene therapies that are fundamentally safer, ensuring that this potentially life-saving technology can be delivered to patients.

Job Title: Research Assistant/Research Associate - Health Data Scientist (Fixed Term)
Job Description:
Research Assistant: £27,929 - £32,348
Research Associate: £34,308 - £42,155
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a key analytical role in the Department of Public Health and Primary Care, University of Cambridge, funded by Cancer Research UK. A key responsibility of the post holder will be to utilise population-wide electronic health records to investigate the generalisability and transportability of models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer.
The post-holder will contribute to the development and application of statistical and machine learning approaches to adapt models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer for clinical use in real world settings. The research will have translational and methodological impact.
The preferred candidate will have a PhD (or equivalent) in Health Data Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research or other related quantitative subjects. Otherwise, if the candidate can demonstrate an outstanding fit to all the other criteria, a good Masters degree in one of the relevant fields will also be considered. They will have strong computational skills in at least one of R, Python, SQL or Pyspark; experience of working with electronic health records; and a good understanding of and experience in statistics and machine learning.

Data Science at Elsevier

Job Description:

What is the Accelerate Analytics & Artificial Intelligence Pathway?
The Analytics and AI (A&AI) pathway of the Accelerate programme is designed for talented graduates passionate about analytics and data science, who are looking for a role where they can combine strategy, technology data science and creative design to help clients solve complex business challenges.

The Focus of Your Role
As an Associate Consultant you will embark on a stimulating and exciting journey where you will develop key skills that influence how our clients evolve the way they work, perform and achieve their goals. You’ll have the opportunity to work on large scale transformation programmes. You will ensure the smooth delivery of end-to-end projects by working flexibly, demonstrating intellectual capability and delivering innovative solutions for clients. The day-to-day tasks can vary from engagement with senior stakeholders, conducting analysis of data, designing business strategies to delivering workshops. Your projects could be in Consumer Products & Retail, Financial Services & Insurance, Government, Utilities, Manufacturing, Automotive & Life Sciences (MALS) or Technology, Media and Telecommunications (TMT).

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe, from a user reviewing a neighborhood coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners, and the general public.

The Data Science team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s business and users. Our centralized team is the most wide-ranging consumer of data at Yelp, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about the health of local economies. With varied backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity requires you to be located in the United Kingdom.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Job Title: 12 Month BioPharmaceuticals and Oncology Research & Development Undergraduate Industrial Student Placement– Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
Job Description:
BioPharmaceuticals and Oncology Research & Development Undergraduate Industrial Placement Programme – Data Science and Artificial Intelligence - 12 month placement
Locations: Cambridge, UK and Gothenburg, SE
About AstraZeneca
We are a global, science-led biopharmaceutical business and our innovative medicines are used by millions of patients worldwide. At AstraZeneca, we’ve long been advocates of industrial placement training. We believe it is our responsibility to help promising scientists develop into the researchers of the future. This is achieved by aligning each student with a research team working on cutting-edge drug discovery projects. You will feel trusted and empowered to take on new challenges, but with all the help and guidance you need to succeed.
About the Programme

Overview:
Exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Scientist to work in an expanding national data team within a large charity.

Responsibilities:
Change, grow, live is a social care and health charity that supports people to change their lives for the better. We are the largest provider of drug and alcohol services across England, Wales and Scotland.

We are recruiting for a Junior Data Scientist who will play an instrumental role in transforming our analytical capabilities. To this end, we are seeking a candidate who is excited by the power of data and can apply their knowledge and use of statistics.

A sound knowledge of Excel is essential as this will lay the foundations as we continue to move to the use of more innovative tools and systems.

We use Alteryx and Tableau however experience of these is desirable but not essential; we are seeking a candidate who is excited by the use of these technologies and full training and support will be provided.

The successful candidate will hold strong technical skills and will come with their own ideas and experiences of how data science, its tools and systems, can provided valuable insight. Meticulous, tenacious and flexible in approach, you will be comfortable working on your own, and as part of a highly geographically disparate team. You will be solution focused.

For those applicants successful at the first stage, there will be a technical test and "meet the team" day on 3rd November 2022. This will be in Leeds and will require people to attend in person. For people who are successful in the technical test, the interviews will be held following this on 8th November 2022. These will also be held in Leeds.

CGL points 24 to 26 (£23562.26 - £24850.76) ILW / OLW /Fringe: N/A - Outside London Weighting Area Interview Date: 8/11/2022 Closing Date: 24/10/2022 If you have any questions on this opportunity that you would like to talk through please contact us using the below details:: Sue Kelly | sue.kelly@cgl.org.uk | 07889075710 :

Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Data & Analytics - Graduate Programme
Locations: London, 250 Bishopsgate
About you
To be eligible for our Data and Analytics graduate programme, you’ll need to have, or be on course to achieving a 2:1 in your degree

Please note that this team has a hub in the Microsoft UK HQ (Reading, Berkshire) however, hybrid/remote working within the UK is possible.

From being able to log you in with face recognition, correct your gaze during a video chat to maintain eye contact, to the exciting possibilities in augmented reality, are you itching to play a part in bringing applications of computer vision to millions?
The Microsoft Applied Sciences Group incubates disruptive technologies for Microsoft’s next-gen hardware products and is working on several exciting projects that will shape how computers and other devices perceive the user and the user’s environment. Operating as a startup within the company, this team works closely with several research and product teams to bring compelling new experiences to the market. A lot of these experiences will be powered by computer vision – and as part of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to work on almost every aspect of a shipping vision system: camera optics, sensors, data pipeline and of course, developing and implementing the algorithms that make magic happen!
The team is growing, and we are looking for talented computer vision and machine learning researchers: people who love to invent and build new stuff that really works and can be deployed to millions of users.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. From a coffee connoisseur’s review of a neighborhood cafe, to a homeowner’s request for a quote to remodel their kitchen, Yelp’s data captures millions of user-business interactions every day.

The Consumer Data Science & Analytics team focuses on the people side of these interactions, harnessing the power of this data to understand and optimize Yelp’s user experience. We design and run experiments, build tools, and lead meaningful analyses that influence Yelp’s consumer product and business strategy.

This opportunity requires you to be located in the United Kingdom.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Job Title: Research Assistant/Research Associate - Health Data Scientist (Fixed Term)
Job Description:
Research Assistant: £27,929 - £32,348
Research Associate: £34,308 - £42,155
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a key analytical role in the Department of Public Health and Primary Care, University of Cambridge, funded by Cancer Research UK. A key responsibility of the post holder will be to utilise population-wide electronic health records to investigate the generalisability and transportability of models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer.
The post-holder will contribute to the development and application of statistical and machine learning approaches to adapt models for the early detection and diagnosis of cancer for clinical use in real world settings. The research will have translational and methodological impact.
The preferred candidate will have a PhD (or equivalent) in Health Data Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research or other related quantitative subjects. Otherwise, if the candidate can demonstrate an outstanding fit to all the other criteria, a good Masters degree in one of the relevant fields will also be considered. They will have strong computational skills in at least one of R, Python, SQL or Pyspark; experience of working with electronic health records; and a good understanding of and experience in statistics and machine learning.

Bioinformatician / Data Scientist
Apply: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/3312690326/
Location: Hinxton, Cambridgeshire.
Job Type: Full-time
Work Model: Hybrid working. Some time required on-site
Company Overview
Broken String Biosciences is a Cambridge-based genomics company with the goal of developing safer cell and gene therapies by assessing the stability of the genome. We are leveraging state of the art genomic sequencing technologies to better understand the factors that determine on and off-target activity during CRISPR genome editing, with the vision to build a technology platform that will drive the development of CRISPR gene therapies that are safer by design. Starting with our first patented technology, INDUCE-seq, which for the first time enables precise digital mapping of DNA double strand breaks in the genome, Broken String Biosciences is building a suite of genomics technologies that will assess all elements of genetic safety during the genome editing process. This will provide the information required to design CRISPR gene therapies that are fundamentally safer, ensuring that this potentially life-saving technology can be delivered to patients.

Job Title: 2023 UK Graduate Data Scientist Career Path

Working as a Data Scientist for our Buildings and Cities (BNC) business, you will join our growing digital solutions team to deliver leading-edge digital solutions to our clients from various industries. By working together, you will help solve complex problems and develop innovative data-driven analytics and solutions in the field of physical and digital infrastructure, all through the application of data science.

You will join an enthusiastic and diverse team of data scientists and Geographic Information Systems professionals passionate about data, location intelligence, analytics and powerful visualisation of the results. Through connected thinking and collaboration with colleagues across the Mott MacDonald organisation internationally you will be part of the wider team of data scientist, software engineers, solution architects, and engineers focusing on excellence and digital innovation.

You will support development of innovative solutions to client’s asset management problems, applying data-science, including machine learning/deep learning and computer vision as well as analysing a broad range of spatial and non-spatial information within the public domain including openly available data, websites, new feeds, connecting to data stream through web services and APIs.

As a Data Scientist you will have a chance to work with and learn from the other members of our team. Within the scope of the projects delivered, you may be responsible for any number of these elements:
Applying AI and advanced analytics, including spatial analytics, to large data sets within the asset management domain and across sectors including Buildings and Cities, Transport, Energy, Water and Environment.
Partnering with other data scientists, software engineers and GIS consultants to define and develop machine learning products on premise or cloud-based platforms.

Designing and implementing ETL processes.

Presenting information using data visualisation techniques.

Inspiring self-serve data use by building dashboards and reports to drive awareness and understanding.

As a Data Scientist you will have a chance to work with and learn from the other members of our team, including GIS professionals, software engineers, data scientists, solution architects, and engineers. Duties to include;
Inspiring self-serve data use by building dashboards and reports to drive awareness and understanding

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe, from a user reviewing a neighborhood coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners, and the general public.

The Data Science team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s business and users. Our centralized team is the most wide-ranging consumer of data at Yelp, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about the health of local economies. With varied backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

From being able to log you in with face recognition, correct your gaze during a video chat to maintain eye contact, to the exciting possibilities in augmented reality, are you itching to play a part in bringing applications of computer vision to millions?
The Microsoft Applied Sciences Group incubates disruptive technologies for Microsoft’s next-gen hardware products and is working on several exciting projects that will shape how computers and other devices perceive the user and the user’s environment.
